chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott A Hammond was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Probation is concurrent on Ct 1, Ct 2 and Ct 3 as are the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified.

miscConds.notes: Fees, surcharges and costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

The defendant shall have no contact with Steven Christopherson or Trevor Bauer of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  Defendant is not to be on or around the premises of Grassland Dairy Products, Greenwood, WI.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.
Defendant is not to possess or take any medications/drugs unless prescribed by a doctor and they are to be taken as prescribed.
Defendant may apply for expunction 1 year after successfully completing probation and all conditions have been met and he has no further criminal offenses.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.
The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.

timeConds.notes: Jail sentence is on Ct 1 only.  Huber granted.  Defendant has 70 days credit for time served.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant granted 135 days credit for time served.
Concurrent with: Jail sentence on Ct 1, Ct 2 and Ct 3 are all concurrent to each other.

Prosecutor, , and Defendant, Scott A Hammond, appeared with Attorney Christine Kuczynski. waiving the preliminary hearing  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 11:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 02:20 pm.
Preliminary hearing on January 30, 2015 at 08:10 am.

District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State;  Defendant appeared in person via video conference from Clark County Jail with Attorney Kuczynski appearing in person in court.   Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  Waived reading of the complaint. Defense requests bond modification to signature bond--Court denies request for signature, but amends to $1000.00  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 08:10 am.
Initial appearance on January 22, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Atty Kuczynski
Initial appearance on January 29, 2015 at 01:20 pm.

Defendant is not to be on or around the premises of Grassland Dairy Products, Greenwood, WI or at the premises of N16631 Cardinal Avenue, Owen WI.     The defendant shall have no contact with S.C. of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  Defendant is not to drive any motorized vehicle: (a) unless defendant is in possession of a valid Wisconsin operator's license for the type of motor vehicle being driven; (b) defendant and such motor vehicle are insured as required by law; and (c) defendant is in possession of valid proof of insurance while operating the motor vehicle.  Defendant is not to possess or take any medications or drugs unless prescribed by a doctor and they are to be taken as prescribed.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.
